channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report X-2023071018
item.description:
Report X-2023071018

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: ROSEVILLE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking when unloaded from trailer. Package was given to QA in a hazmat tote. DescribePack: Plastic seal on the cap was cracked/otherwise damaged from improper manufacturing. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a hazmat tote as soon as leakage was noticed.

item.title: Report X-2023070690
item.description:
Report X-2023070690

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-02
  • City: STEWARTVILLE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023070690 SequenceEvent: Package was placed on the back of the trailer with nothing securing it and with the loose cap it tipped over and contents leaked out DescribePack: one of the caps was not secured so when package tipped contents leaked out DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was turned upright and placed into a salvage drum. 2. X-2023070691 SequenceEvent: package was loaded on the end of the trailer with nothing to secure it and with the loose cap some of the contents leaked out DescribePack: 1 of the jugs had a loose cap which leaked out some contents DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed into a salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2023061354
item.description:
Report X-2023061354

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: Maple Grove
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 22nd, FedEx Ground dropped of a package at an express station. The package was found to have an odor of fuel and a leak on one side of the package. There were no marks on the outside of the package indicating that it contained and dangerous goods. The station is hold the package for further disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023061331
item.description:
Report X-2023061331

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: This package (772418606624) was found while unloading a PM Express shuttle from the FedEx Ground facility in Willmar, MN. The courier suspected this package was DG due to the markings on the box calling in herbicide and being in UN spec packaging. He brought it to manager Wayne Peterson's attention before the truck was offloaded. The manager inspected the package and looked up the SDS online to verify transportation information. In section 14 this chemical is listed as IATA regulated for air transport, as a UN 3082. As the package contained 2 inner containers, both containing 2.5 Gallons (9.45 L) this package would not qualify for shipment under special provision 197. It should be noted according to the SDS this package would not be regulated if it were to solely travel via truck. Package was instructed to be bumped by the Express station and to contact the FedEx Ground Facility it came from and have them retrieve the package. A second identical package was (772418607561) discovered later that night and was give n the same disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023070891
item.description:
Report X-2023070891

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: OSSEO
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package sent on sorter from unload box was wet when it got to the door on load side and was leaking. Pulled from conveyor and called out to QA. DescribePack: can clips on lid were popped off due to lake of inner packaging and proper shipping procedures. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA used absorb pads to soak up spill .Maint .scraped off conveyor and equipment

item.title: Report E-2023070602
item.description:
Report E-2023070602

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-07T15:11:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: EAGAN
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The driver was attempting to off-load a roll-off box in the lot when liquid started to spill out of the top of the roll-off under the cover. He stopped immediately once he noticed the spill and put down containment booms and adsorbent. The spill was contained on a paved parking lot and did not reach any waterways. The cleanup was done using the appropriate PPE and was put into the appropriate containers for disposal.

  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the metal 5 gallon pail of paint (un1263) releasing 5 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
